import React, { useContext } from "react"; import selfie from "../../images/selfie.png"; import linkedin from "../../images/linkedin.png"; import github from "../../images/github.png"; import email from "../../images/email.png"; import { Reveal, Reveal2, Reveal3, Reveal4, Reveal5, RevealPic, } from "../utils/Reveal"; import { userContext } from "../../Context/userContext"; const About = () => { const { isDesktop } = useContext(userContext); return (
{/* */} {isDesktop && ( <> )}

ABOUT ME

How ya doin? I'm Hanson, a front end developer with an eye for eloquent design. That's because each need the other to complete a perfect system. I'm a problem solver. I have a passion for building functional yet easy to use solutions for common problems. In my downtime you'll find me extreme couponing, playing piano, or feeling strongly about a TV show.

); }; export default About;
